SEARCH
Module com.example.dicerollerproject
Package com.example.dicerollerproject

Class DatabaseConnection

java.lang.Object
com.example.dicerollerproject.DatabaseConnection
public class DatabaseConnection extends Object
The DatabaseConnection class provides methods to interact with an SQLite database for storing and retrieving roll values and custom roll definitions. It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure only one database connection exists.

      public static Connection getInstance()
      Gets the database connection instance, creating it if necessary.
      Returns:
      The connection instance to the SQLite database.

    • insertRoll

      Inserts a roll value into the 'rolls' table.
      Parameters:
      rollValue - The value of the roll to be inserted.

      Clears all entries from the 'rolls' table.

    • getAllRolls

      public static List<HistoryController.Roll> getAllRolls()
      Retrieves all roll entries from the 'rolls' table.
      Returns:
      A list of Roll objects representing all stored rolls.

    • SaveCustomRoll

      public static void SaveCustomRoll(String rollName, String rollFormula, String username)
      Saves a custom roll to the 'custom_rolls' table.
      Parameters:
      rollName - The name of the custom roll.
      rollFormula - The formula used to calculate the custom roll.
      username - The user associated with the custom roll.

    • GetCustomRolls

      public static List<String> GetCustomRolls(String username)
      Retrieves all custom roll names for a given user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username whose custom rolls are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of custom roll names associated with the specified user.

    • GetRollFormat

      public static String GetRollFormat(String rollName, String username)
      Retrieves the formula associated with a custom roll for a given user.
      Parameters:
      rollName - The name of the custom roll.
      username - The username associated with the custom roll.
      Returns:
      The formula for the specified custom roll.
